intro: Corydalis calcicola var. szechuanica, commonly known as the Sichuan corydalis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of delicate, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom in early summer. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in rock gardens.
